comments.text:
Fuck Drive (continued) ....Let me also add that I prove my assumptions 
because they could NEVER flip the script and create a "Car that will get 
you beat up in New York, California, Florida, or any other state that will 
get you beat up" because they know the only way would be too have a car 
with a hatred for humanity sticker. Lastly, I strongly doubt the entire 
state of Texas has come a long way to want to have that kind of flag.
comments.author: tim23tom23

comments.text:
Fuck DRIVE.... I viewed that little "Cars That Will Get You Beat-Up In 
Texas" video and have to say that if they think people can't see the 
underlining in that video you people at DRIVE are fucking retarded. Maybe 
I'm a bit upset because I live in a sophisticated society, you know the 
ones that ACTUALLY care about the cars you video, that found it somewhat 
shocking that you guys (or just Matt) glamorized the ignorance of a few. It 
was never about the cars but rather the symbolism associated.
comments.author: tim23tom23

comments.text:
This IS a TV show in my house. Like chrishazify, I'm really happy with this 
new media. Just because this show is not on your local MSO does not take 
away availability or make it any less accessible. In fact, quite the 
opposite. Their YouTube platform helps vault them over traditional outlets 
and opens many more doors. I too, would like to see expanded segs but 
that's an investment decision on their end and I have no idea whether the 
rev here would support that.
